name: Ahmad Basyouni
about: Hello! I'm Ahmad Basyouni, a Computer Engineering student at CUNY CSI ('26) with a passion for problem-solving and creating impactful solutions. My journey into tech began at age 10, building and fixing computers, which evolved into creating servers and exploring software. I've had the privilege of being a Software Engineering Intern at Warner Bros. Discovery and a Production Engineering Fellow with Meta x MLH.

work_experiences.title: Production Engineer
details: Developing skills in DevOps, infrastructure, and distributed systems as a Production Engineering Fellow, focusing on the principles of reliability and scalability that power Meta's services.

work_experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern, HBO Max
details: Contributing to the GCX Instrumentation Tooling team for HBO Max, utilizing Kotlin and TypeScript to enhance monitoring and content delivery systems.

work_experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern
details: Engineered a full-stack AI-driven school platform for over 1,000 students using React, TypeScript, and Python.
Implemented a Go microservice and set up a full CI/CD pipeline with AWS, Jenkins, and Docker, cutting deployment times by 30%.
Relevant Coursework: Object Oriented Programming, Operating Systems, Data Structures, System Design.
Affiliations: CodePath TA, CUNY Tech Prep, SEO, CS Club.

hobbies.name: Soccer
hobbies.desc: I'm an avid soccer fan and player, enjoying both watching matches and playing in local leagues. It's a great way to stay active, sharpen my strategic thinking, and work as part of a team.
